page.title: 19FARM AND RESERVOIR
page.content: Great Eaves farm, covering eighty-five acres is about three kilometres from Hanley's centre, on the edge of Bucknall and indeed the city boundary. The farming family have held the tenancy from Staffordshire County Council for thirty seven years.The stock in June 1985 included fifty beef cattle,sixteen calves and about four hundred sheep.These are sent to market either at Uttoxeter or Newcastle. Part of one of the fields is fenced off by the Severn Trent Water Authority.Two tanks holding over nine thousand cubic metres of water were constructed there in 1959.This covered reservoir supplies water to the Bentilee housing estate and most of Abbey Hulton. From the reservoir one has a sweeping panoramic view across Bucknall to the tower blocks of Hanley on the horizon.
